```
WHEREFORE, the United States respectfully requests the following relief:
a.  A declaratory judgment stating that Idaho Code § 18-622 violates the Supremacy Clause and is preempted and therefore invalid to the extent that it conflicts with EMTALA; 
b.  A declaratory judgment stating that Idaho may not initiate a prosecution against, seek to impose any form of liability on, or attempt to revoke the professional license of any medical provider based on that provider’s performance of an abortion that is authorized under EMTALA; 
c.  A preliminary and permanent injunction against the State of Idaho—including all of its officers, employees, and agents—prohibiting enforcement of Idaho Code § 18-622(2)-(3) to the extent that it conflicts with EMTALA; 
d.  Any and all other relief necessary to fully effectuate the injunction against Idaho Code § 18-622’s enforcement to the extent it conflicts with EMTALA; 
e.  The United States’ costs in this action; and 
f.  Any other relief that the Court deems just and proper.
```

evidence.text: A preliminary and permanent injunction against the State of Idaho—including all of its officers, employees, and agents—prohibiting enforcement of Idaho Code § 18-622(2)-(3) to the extent that it conflicts with EMTALA;

extracted.value: any and all other relief necessary to fully effectuate the injunction against Idaho Code § 18-622’s enforcement to the extent it conflicts with EMTALA

evidence.text: Any and all other relief necessary to fully effectuate the injunction against Idaho Code § 18-622’s enforcement to the extent it conflicts with EMTALA;

extracted.value: United States’ costs in this action

evidence.text: The United States’ costs in this action;

extracted.value: any other relief that the Court deems just and proper

evidence.text: Any other relief that the Court deems just and proper.
